twophase

Class CubieCube

  • java.lang.Object
    • twophase.CubieCube

  •  class CubieCube
extends java.lang.Object
    Cube on the cubie level
    explanation on kociemba's site

    • Field Detail

      • cp

        Corner[] cp
        Corner permutation, represented in the "is replaced by" representation

      • co

        byte[] co
        Corner orientation.
        The i-th orientation is the orientation of the corner that is currently at index i in cp

      • ep

        Edge[] ep
        Edge permutation, represented in the "is replaced by" representation

      • eo

        byte[] eo
        Edge orientation
        The i-th orientation is the orientation of the edge that is currently at index i in ep

      • toFaceCube

        FaceCube toFaceCube()
        return cube in facelet representation

      • cornerMultiply

        void cornerMultiply(CubieCube b)
        Multiply this CubieCube with another CubieCube b, restricted to the corners. This is equivalent to applying the maneuvers done to b on this cube, but we only get the effect on the corners (on both their permutation and orientation)
        Parameters:
        b - - the cube to multiply by

      • edgeMultiply

        void edgeMultiply(CubieCube b)
        Multiply this CubieCube with another CubieCube b, restricted to the edges. This is equivalent to applying the maneuvers done to b on this cube, but we only get the effect on the edges (on both their permutation and orientation)
        Parameters:
        b - - the cube to multiply by

      • multiply

        void multiply(CubieCube b)
        Multiply this CubieCube with another CubieCube b
        Parameters:
        b - - the cube to multiply by

      • getInvCubieCube

        CubieCube getInvCubieCube()
        Computes the "inverse cube" of current cube. This means that if we multiply current cube by the inverse cube, we get the solved cube ("the identity cube")
        Returns:
        CubieCube representing the inverse cube of the current CubieCube

      • getTwist

        short getTwist()
        Returns:
        corners orientation coordinate

      • setTwist

        void setTwist(short twist)
        Sets corners orientation according to coordinate value
        Parameters:
        twist - - corners orientation coordinate. 0 <= twist < 3^7

      • getFlip

        short getFlip()
        Returns:
        edges orientation coordinate

      • setFlip

        void setFlip(short flip)
        Sets edges orientation according to coordinate value
        Parameters:
        flip - - edges orientation coordinate. 0 <= flip < 2^11

      • cornerParity

        short cornerParity()
        Returns:
        the parity of the corner permutation. Parity of corners and edges are the same if the cube is solvable.

      • edgeParity

        short edgeParity()
        Returns:
        the parity of the edges permutation. Parity of corners and edges are the same if the cube is solvable.

      • getFRtoBR

        short getFRtoBR()
        Returns:
        the UD-slice edges FR,FL,BL and BR permutation's coordinate

      • setFRtoBR

        void setFRtoBR(short idx)
        Sets permutation of the UD-slice edges FR,FL,BL and BR
        Parameters:
        idx - - permutation coordinate value

      • getURFtoDLF

        short getURFtoDLF()
        Returns:
        all corners except DBL and DRB permutation's coordinate

      • setURFtoDLF

        void setURFtoDLF(short idx)
        Sets permutation of all corners except DBL and DRB
        Parameters:
        idx - - permutation coordinate value

      • getURtoDF

        int getURtoDF()
        Permutation of the six edges UR,UF,UL,UB,DR,DF. Positions of the DL and DB edges are determined by the parity. Relevant in phase 2 when FR, FL, BL and BR are already in the UD slice
        Returns:
        the six edges UR,UF,UL,UB,DR,DF permutation's coordinate

      • setURtoDF

        void setURtoDF(int idx)
        Permutation of the six edges UR,UF,UL,UB,DR,DF. Positions of the DL and DB edges are determined by the parity. Relevant in phase 2 when FR, FL, BL and BR are already in the UD slice
        Parameters:
        idx - - permutation coordinate value

      • getURtoDF

        public static int getURtoDF(short idx1,
            short idx2)
        Permutation of the six edges UR,UF,UL,UB,DR,DF
        Parameters:
        idx1 - - UR, UF and UL permutation coordinate value
        idx2 - - UB, DR and DF permutation coordinate value
        Returns:
        the six edges UR,UF,UL,UB,DR,DF permutation coordinate

      • getURtoUL

        short getURtoUL()
        Permutation of the three edges UR,UF,UL
        Returns:
        the three edges UR,UF,UL permutation coordinate

      • setURtoUL

        void setURtoUL(short idx)
        Sets the permutation of the three edges UR,UF,UL
        Parameters:
        idx - - permutation coordinate value

      • getUBtoDF

        short getUBtoDF()
        Permutation of the three edges UB,DR,DF
        Returns:
        the three edges UB,DR,DF permutation coordinate

      • setUBtoDF

        void setUBtoDF(short idx)
        Sets the permutation of the three edges UB,DR,DF
        Parameters:
        idx - - permutation coordinate value

      • verify

        int verify()
        Validate received cube (check that it is a valid one)
        Returns:
        error code: 0: Cube is solvable -2: Not all 12 edges exist exactly once -3: Flip error: One edge has to be flipped -4: Not all corners exist exactly once -5: Twist error: One corner has to be twisted -6: Parity error: Two corners or two edges have to be exchanged

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
